intro: Galium coronatum var. tauricum, commonly known as the Tauric bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, ascending stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
